IX.iii.1.l.1
.j
.
USGLI, NSLI, and TDIP
Count the following types of income:
United States Government Life Insurance (USGLI) proceeds
National Service Life Insurance (NSLI) proceeds, and
Total Disability Insurance Payments (TDIP).
Insurance dividends are not countable unless they are left on deposit to draw interest.Â  In that event, only the interest earned is countable income.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section I - Counting Specific Types of Income
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section I
